alert.note: Alert for Gibson (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 03 at 7:40AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southern Illinois and southwest Indiana, including the following counties, in southern Illinois, Wabash. In southwest Indiana, Gibson. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 638 AM CDT, trained weather spotters several areas of standing water and flooding on Highway 168 in Gibson County, Indiana, between Owensville and Fort Branch due to earlier heavy rain. Flooding is already occurring. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Princeton, Fort Branch, Oakland City, Haubstadt, Owensville, Francisco, Somerville, Bellmont, Keensburg and Mackey.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
